description:
Redevelopment of site to provide a 5 storey plus basement
building, comprising carparking in basement, 2 Class A1 and
Class A1/A2/D2 units on ground floor, and 27 self-contained
flats (6 for Housing Association use) on 1st-4th floors.
As shown on drawing numbers 101/01B, 2C, 3D, 4C, 5B, 6B, 7B;
letters from Liberty Finance dated 2nd and 5th March 2001,
letter from Alastair Ritchie dated 30/01/01 and attached
letter from Notting Hill Housing Trust dated 29/01/01.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - The detailed design of the inset shopfronts to be installed
    on the ground floor of the front and side elevations (at a
    scale of 1:20) shall not be otherwise than as shall have
    been submitted to and approved by the Council before any
    work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 3 - The detailed design of the proposed windows, balconies,
    parapet features, garage and store doors, ventilation
    grilles, lighting and other elevational features (at a scale
    of 1:20) shall not be otherwise than as shall have been
    submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on
    the site is commenced.

Condition : 4 - The development shall be constructed in strict accordance with the drawings hereby approved or drawings which are subsequently approved pursuant to conditions which are attached to this planning permission.
Condition : 5 - Details of the proposed roof plant shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 6 - The proposed Class A1/A2/D2 unit on the ground floor, as
    shown on drawing no. 2C hereby approved, shall be used for
    any use, or any combination thereof, within Classes A1
    (retail), A2 (financial service) or D2 (leisure), as defined
    by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987,
    and subject to the provisions of condition 7 below.

Condition : 7 - The proposed Class D2 use in the rear ground floor A1/A2
    unit, as shown on drawing no. 2C hereby approved, shall be
    used only for a health club/gymnasium and for no other
    purpose, (including any other purpose within Class D2 of the
    Schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes)
    Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in
    any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that
    Order. (CF02, amended)

Condition : 8 - The proposed 6 flats (nos. 1,2,3,6,7,8 on 1st floor), as
    shown on drawing no. 3D hereby approved, shall be only for
    Housing Association use and shall be implemented and made
    available for occupation at the same time as the private
    residential units.

Condition : 9 - No process  shall be carried on or machinery installed which is not such as could be carried on or installed in any residential area without detriment to the amenity of that area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke, soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 10 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining highway. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2 [and SH18 if A3 use] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing no.1B hereby
    approved, revised details of the proposed basement plan
    showing numbers, design and layout of parking spaces (both
    for general and disabled use) and cycle stands shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council before any works
    commence on site. The parking spaces and cycle stands shall
    be implemented in accordance with the details prior to
    occupation of the building and thereafter permanently
    maintained.

Condition : 13 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the building.

Reason: To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - Before the development is occupied the [turning head] [service bay] within the site shall be clearly marked out in thermoplastic paint stating "No Parking". Thereafter, at no time shall any goods, vehicles, plant equipment or other obstruction be left in this area and the markings shall be permanently maintained and retained unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: In order to satisfactorily provide for the turning of vehicles within the site and in the interests of highways and pedestrian safety in accordance with policy TR23 and DS9 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - Details of pedestrian warning signs, to be erected adjoining
    the proposed car ramp and service bay in Springfield Lane,
    shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before the
    occupation of the new building. The signs shall be
    implemented in accordance with the details prior to
    occupation of the building and thereafter permanently
    maintained.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN16 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 19 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 20 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 21 - To ensure that the future occupation of the building shall
    be in accordance with the Council's policy for retail, local
    service and leisure uses, as set out in policies SH2, SH3,
    SH8 and LC1 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000, and in accordance with Schedule 2
    Part 3 Class E of the Town and Country Planning (General
    Permitted Development) Order 1995. (DF02, amended)

Condition : 22 - To ensure that the future occupation of the building shall
    be in accordance with the Council's policy for leisure uses
    and to ensure that it safeguards amenities of adjoining
    premises and the area generally, as set out in policies LC1
    and RE* of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development
    Plan 2000. (DF02, amended)

Condition : 23 - In order to ensure that the development is completed and
    occupied as permitted in accordance with the requirements of
    policies HG8 and HG11 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 24 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE* of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 25 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE* of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 26 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE* of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 27 - In order to ensure that the scheme complies with the
    Council's standards on vehicle and cycle parking, as set out
    in policies TR17 and TR22 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 28 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with
    the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 29 - To ensure the availability of the facilities in
    accordance with the approved scheme in order to ensure
    compliance with the requirements of policy TR23 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 30 - In order to prevent any safety hazard to pedestrians in
    accordance with the requirements of policy TR19 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 31 - The Council's Engineering Services should be consulted
    regarding the construction of the crossover on the public
    highway and any other work to, under or over the public
    highway, including vaults and thresholds. The Section
    dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street, London WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020 7278 4444).

Condition : 32 - Your proposals may be subject to control under the Building
    Act 1984, the Building Regulations and the London Building
    Acts: 1930-82, and you are advised to consult the Council's
    Building Control Service, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street
    WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020 7974 6941).
    6941)

Condition : 33 - Your attention is drawn to the need to consult the Council's
    Waste Management Service, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street
    London, WC1H 8EQ, (tel:020 7278 4444) regarding arrangements
    for the disposal of refuse.

Condition : 34 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 35 - This permission is granted without prejudice to the
    necessity of obtaining consent under the Town and Country
    Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992.
    Application forms may be obtained from the Council's
    One Stop Reception, Environment Department, Camden Town
    Hall, Argyle Street, London WC1H 8EQ. (Tel 020 7278 4444)

Condition : 36 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939 (IH07)

Condition : 37 - In good time, prior to the start of construction (or if
    appropriate, demolition) on site, the contractor shall
    discuss and agree with the Council's Traffic Management
    Service (tel:020-7974 5629) detailed arrangements for
    the transportation of goods and materials to and from the
    site. The Council will prosecute those responsible for
    anybreaches of the provisions of the Highways and Litter
    Acts which occur as a result of construction on the site.

Condition : 38 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 39 - Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the
    requirements of Railtrack for work affecting their property,
    as contained in their letter to the Council dated 24.3.99.

Condition : 40 - Change of use from one Use Class use to another within the
    range hereby approved, as referred to in condition 6 above,
    must take place within 10 years of the date of this
    permission, in accordance with Schedule 2 Part 3 Class E of
    the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted
    Development) Order 1995.
